oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hallmarks of Country Music - Crash Craddock
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of an interview of Crash Craddock (musician). The interview is hosted by Rick Phillips (army sergeant/ radio host) for the Hallmarks of Country Music segment. The tape was recorded on an unidentified date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Crash Craddock; Rick Phillips
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Rick Phillips introduces Crash Craddock, and both discuss the longevity of Craddock's career -- (01:51) Craddock reveals that he began working with his brother at thirteen years of age -- (02:38) Phillips inquires as to how Craddock got his nickname -- (03:41) Phillips inquires as to why Craddock chose to record ""Going to Knock on Your Door"" -- (05:25) Phillips and Craddock reflect on Stonewall Jackson's ""Don't be Angry"" -- (06:05) ""Til the Water Stops Running"" is described by Craddock as a title he did not understand prior to hearing the song; additionally, Craddock praises Elvis Presley -- (09:14) Phillips forgets his question for Craddock, and Phillips inquires about Craddock's show schedule -- (11:44) Phillips praises Craddock while asking about Craddock's favorite venues of entertainment -- (12:46) Phillips inquires as to what happens when someone rerecords a track while discussing ""Stop if You Love Me"" -- (14:47) Craddock says that ""It's Hard to Love a Hungry Worried Man"" is his favorite song off his album -- (16:30) Phillips inquires as to whether or not Presley has an influence on ""It's Hard to Love a Hungry Worried Man"" -- (18:11) Craddock reflects on the maturation process of country music -- (20:04) Phillips asks who else recorded ""Rub it In"" -- (21:57) Phillips and Craddock say their goodbyes -- (22:13) Phillips inquires about Craddock's future goals
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Insert is of program information. The insert features time stamps.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Craddock, Billy; Phillips, Rick;
